messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] OT-need advice on unjobbing/single motherunschoo...
messages.msgSnippet: ... one session a year ago in preparation for a trip to Mexico.  It was definitely too schoolish for me, but there are lots of people out there who want that
messages.messageBody:
>
> A woman in my community teaches Spanish to children in her home. We took
one session a year ago in preparation for a trip to Mexico. It was
definitely too schoolish for me, but there are lots of people out there who
want that sort of experience. She started out with one class, word spread,
and she is not quite busy. The thing I liked best about her class is that
she wanted the parents to stay. Not all did though, as it wasn't required.
She used Risas and Sonrisas. The program incorporates lots of games.

There's a single mum unschooling in a tiny community in BC doing that. She
also does a bunch of other stuff to make ends meet because there aren't
enough people nearby to teach Spanish to. <G>
Tia
leschke@...

"Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where
there is no path and leave a trail."
- Ralph Waldo Emerson
